required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immune Response to COVID-19 Vaccine in Recipients of Living Donor Liver Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Immune Response to COVID-19 Vaccine in Recipients of Living Donor Liver Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective cohort study to evaluate the response to COVID-19 vaccine in liver transplantation patients.

detailed_description.textblock: fifty living donor liver transplantation recipients during maintenance immunosuppression phase will be vaccinated against COVID-19 followed by assessment of immune response to the vaccine and further investigation of correlation of immune response to genetic polymorphisms of HLA DRB1(rs2647087) gene and IL-18 (rs187238 and rs917997) gene.

primary_outcome.measure: Neutralizing antibody titer change 14 days after vaccination compared to baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 14 days after whole course of vaccination
primary_outcome.description: neutralizing antibody response to SARS-CoV-2 vaccine in recipients post living donor liver transplantation

primary_outcome.measure: Neutralizing antibody titer change 28 days post vaccination compared to baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and 28 days after whole course of vaccination
primary_outcome.description: neutralizing antibody response to SARS-CoV-2 vaccine in recipients post living donor liver transplantation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline, at 14 and 28 days after whole course of vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing the cellular immunological response to SARS-CoV-2 vaccine in recipients post living donor liver transplantation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 28 days after whole course of vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Patient follow-up for confirmed symptomatic infection by SARS-COV2 virus

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events related to vaccine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 7 days after each dose of the vaccine and up to 28 days after last vaccine dose administered
secondary_outcome.description: Self reported safety and tolerability of vaccine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: On 14 and 28 days post whole course vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Follow-up for signs and symptoms of graft rejection

secondary_outcome.measure: Immune response correlation to HLA DRB1 genetic polymorphism
secondary_outcome.description: TaqMan®️ SNP genotyping assay of HLA DRB1 gene (rs2647087)

secondary_outcome.measure: Immune response correlation to IL-18 genetic polymorphism
secondary_outcome.description: TaqMan®️ SNP genotyping assay of IL-18 gene (rs187238 and rs917997)

arm_group.description: Fifty living donor liver transplantation recipients on maintenance immunosuppressive regimen who would receive COVID-19 vaccine at least 3 months postoperatively.

intervention.description: Severe acute respiratory syndrome- coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2)vaccine according to vaccine availability in the Egyptian ministry of health.

study_pop.textblock: Living donor liver transplantation recipients willing to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and capable of signing an informed consent to participate in this cohort

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age>18
- At least 3 month post transplantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- pediatric recipients
- Active covid infection at the time of the study
- Pregnancy
- Allergy to any ingredients included in the vaccine
- Lactation in first six month of delivery
- Active Acute cellular rejection proven by liver biopsy
- Acute Febrile state with either leucopenia or leucocytosis
- High dose of corticosteroid at study timing (pulse methyl prednisolone)

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Pharmacy, Ain Shams University

facility.name: Ain Shams center for organ transplantation (ASCOT), Ain shams university specialized hospital

address.state: Please Select Region, State Or Province
